title: Scott Stewart (director)
text:
Scott Charles Stewart is an American filmmaker and <a href="visual%20effects">visual effects artist</a>. He was one of the principal co-founders of <a href="The%20%20Orphanage%20%28company%29">The Orphanage</a>, a prolific <a href="Los%20Angeles">Los Angeles</a> effects house that worked on dozens of high-profile projects. As a director, he helmed the <a href="dark%20%20fantasy">dark fantasy</a> action-horror films "<a href="Legion%20%282010%20film%29">Legion</a>" and "<a href="Priest%20%282011%20film%29">Priest</a>", and the alien abduction thriller "<a href="Dark%20Skies%20%282013%20film%29">Dark Skies</a>". He also executive produced the television series "<a href="Dominion%20%28TV%20series%29">Dominion</a>", a sequel to the former film. Stewart has also directed, produced, and realized dozens of short films and television commercials.
Biography.
Stewart was a senior staffer at the visual effects company <a href="The%20Orphanage%20%28company%29">The Orphanage</a>. Stewart directed and wrote the <a href="Apocalypticism">apocalyptic</a> thriller "<a href="Legion%20%282010%20film%29">Legion</a>". He directed the <a href="vampire%20film">vampire</a>-<a href="Western%20film%23Film">western</a> horror film "<a href="Priest%20%282011%20film%29">Priest</a>".
Associations.
He has used actor <a href="Paul%20Bettany">Paul Bettany</a> in the lead role on his first two directed features, "Legion" and "Priest".
